channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: UK business confidence weakened and hiring fell at end of 2025, surveys find
item.description: Rising costs and economic uncertainty take toll, in contrast to Keir Starmer saying Britain will start to feel richer UK business confidence weakened ...

item.title: Amy Scott, police officer who confronted Bondi junction stabber, diagnosed with ‘rare and aggressive’ breast cancer
item.description: More than $80,000 already raised to support treatment of Scott, who confronted Joel Cauchi alone during the April 2024 Westfield attack Follow our Aus...

item.title: Australia news live: Allan says claims CFA funding has been cut are ‘just wrong’; more than 350 structures lost in Victoria bushfires
item.description: Emergency assistance payments of up to $52,250 made available to eligible uninsured households to re-establish their principal place of residence. Fol...

item.title: Justice department opens investigation into Jerome Powell as Trump ramps up campaign against Federal Reserve
item.description: Fed chair accuses DoJ of threatening criminal charges over building renovation projects because central bank defied Trump’s interest rate demands The ...

item.title: Andrew Clements, Guardian’s classical music critic, dies aged 75
item.description: An outstanding critical voice, his deep knowledge and love of music was evident in everything he wrote The Guardian’s long-serving and much admired cl...

item.title: US justice department opens criminal probe into Fed chair Jerome Powell
item.description: Powell called the probe "unprecedented" and came after his refusal to lower interest rates after demands by Donald Trump.

item.title: Golden Globes host Nikki Glaser's best jokes
item.description: The US comic delivered a scorching opening monologue that roasted the A-listers in the room.

item.title: Parents of under-fives to be offered screen time guidance
item.description: Children who spend the most time on devices or in front of screens find conversation and learning harder, the government says.

item.title: Star glamour on the Golden Globes red carpet
item.description: The Golden Globes, one of Hollywood's leading awards ceremonies, is taking place in Los Angeles.

item.title: Iran warns it will retaliate if US attacks, as hundreds killed in protests
item.description: President Trump said on Sunday that the US military was considering "very strong options" in Iran.
